result.execSummary:
Jeffery L Hall was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Jeffery L Hall was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffery L Hall

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: State of Wisconsin Executive Department Warrant.
State of Florida Extradition Warrant, Application for Requisition, Affidavit in Aid of Extradition

3:49 Defendant Jeffery L Hall in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Arendt contests whether he was underarrest under the governor's warrant under time limit alloted.  Court states that it is a good warrant.  Atty Arendt believes the issue should be rendered mute due to 2 issues.  First being his identity and secondly because he was not within the State of Florida at the time.  Court finds that Jeffrey Hall and Niko are the same person.  Atty Zell argues the ability of Hall to file an action for Habeas Corpus.  Court is satisfied with what has been filed by the State of Florida and that Jeffrey Hall should be extradited to Florida within 30 days.  Hall may file an action for Habeas Corpus within that 30 days.

1:22 Defendant Jeffery L Hall in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Zell informs the court that the Governors Warrant was issued and received by the jail.  Hall has been held on that Governor's Warrant.  Atty Arendt does not wish to waive the Governor's Warrant.  Believes the time has actually lapsed as they did not receive the warrant from the DAs office.  Warrant was received on June 25, 2015 per Mike Malooley of the Sheriff's Dept.  Court will have to look into the time and will hear again at 3:45 pm.

Defendant Jeffery L Hall in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt.  Defendant Jeffery L Hall in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Lambert requests a 60 day extension.  

Court grants.

Defendant Jeffery L Hall in court with attorney David R. Dickmann - SA.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Dickmann asks to adjourn appearance until counsel can be appointed to Mr Hall along with 15CM235.  Matter in 15CM235 is treated as a bond hearing and Court orders no bond in this case.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.
